intro: Acianthera cearensis, commonly known as the Ceará orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Brazil. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its intricate, showy flowers with a distinct coloration. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in forest understories. Its floral structure includes a labellum that is highly specialized for pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
